title: Beginner Zone 2 Cardio Workout - BODYWEIGHT/NO EQUIPMENT | 20 Minutes
description:
Looking to build your cardio base, strengthen your heart, and burn fat? Try this 20-minute Zone 2 Cardio Bodyweight workout designed by Sunny Trainer, James King III. Keep your body moving and your heart rate in Zone 2 by completing this workout a few times a week.

00:00 Warm Up: Start the workout with a warm-up to prepare your body for the exercises to come.

2:23 Arm Swings
Swing your arms back and forth to loosen up your shoulders.

2:49 Hip Circles 
Circle your hips in one direction, then switch to the other direction.

Workout : The main workout consists of 6 exercises that you will repeat 3 times. Each exercise lasts 30 seconds, and you'll have a 10-second break between each exercise.

3:27 Double Punch to Kickback 
Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and fists up by your chin. Punch out with both fists, then kick one leg back while punching with the opposite fist. Alternate sides with each rep.

3:50 High March 
March in place while lifting your knees as high as you can. Swing your arms to help with momentum.

4:26 Hands to Knees 
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands behind your head. Lean forward and touch your hands to your knees, then stand back up straight.

4:57 Punch Step Jack 
Start with your feet together and fists up by your chin. Step out to the side with one foot while punching with the opposite fist. Bring your foot back to center and repeat on the other side.

5:28 Overhead Reach with Lateral Step-backs 
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms overhead. Step back with one foot while lowering your arms to shoulder height. Step back to center and repeat on the other side.

6:04 Pivot Punch 
Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and fists up by your chin. Pivot on one foot while punching with the opposite fist. Pivot back to center and repeat on the other side.

20:53 Cool Down: After the workout, take some time to cool down and stretch out your muscles.

21:23 Chest Stretch with Forward Fold
Stand with your feet hip-width apart and clasp your hands behind your back. Bend forward at the waist while lifting your hands up behind you to stretch your chest.

22:05 Standing Calf Stretch 
Step one foot back and press your heel into the ground while

comments: More zone 2 cardio workouts please! Thanks

Thank you coach for this!
I was struggling with Major anxiety when I started this. There have been a lot of other changes I have brought into my life but every time I do this workout, I feel the boost of positivity!
Grateful for this & the way you keep making conversations throughout the video. No matter how many times I watch & practice it, it makes me feel good each time ❤

NO CUZ WE NEED MORE OF THIS DESPERATELY. Tell me why I look this up on YouTube and hardly anybody is doing it. This is the most important type of fitness especially people who are new to fitness need to have

I loved your message about not having to do all or nothing and being able to do a cardio workout that I could feel great doing the whole time rather than feeling like I was going to keel over. Thanks for the great workout and for your positivity.
First timer!  Easy to follow and make me feel confident that I can do it to the end.  My doctor asked me to do zone 2 exercise 200min a week.  I’d like to see more zone 2 exercise if possible😊
